title: Senior iOS Developer (Minneapolis, MN or multiple locations)
full_description: At U.S. Bank, we're passionate about helping customers and the communities where we live and work. The fifth-largest bank in the United States, we're one of the country's most respected, innovative and successful financial institutions. U.S. Bank is an equal opportunity employer committed to creating a diverse workforce. We consider all qualified applicants without regard to race, religion, color, sex, national origin, age, sexual orientation, gender identity, disability or veteran status, among other factors.Job DescriptionAt U.S. Bank we love to amaze our customers, so we've been building something truly amazing to serve them.We call it the Shield operating system, built by a 1000-person integrated experience and technology team that is charging into future of financial technology with a singular focus - our customer.We're looking for the best and the brightest. The masters of their craft, the perpetually curious, the problem solvers, the innovators. You know how turn a complex problem into an intuitive solution.As a UX engineer at U.S. Bank you are at the heart of creating our customer's digital experiences for devices, at our branches, and our ATM's.You'll need a healthy passion for atomic principles, fluid grid, design systems, tokens, JavaScript, React, DevOps, automation, systems level thinking, machine learning, and of course an exceptional attention to detail and qualityYou will be a member of an enterprise wide UX Engineering practice where the primary objective is to build for the future with our Shield design system - and to deliver amazing experiences for web, mobile, wearables, ATM's, and in-branch systems.You'll be the glue between UX and engineering, not just "the bridge". You will work closely on small to mid-size teams with our researchers, UX designers, accessibility experts, product owners, and of course the broader community within the technology group.You'll be aligned to one of our new Platforms Reuse and Interface teams, one of our business segment product teams, or the enterprise Shield design system team.Basic Qualifications- Bachelor's degree, or equivalent experience- Six to eight years of related work experiencePreferred Skills/Experience-Master knowledge of UX best practices, interactive design principles, guidelines, including current mobile accessibility standards-High proficiency in at least one of the following languages: Swift or Objective-C and an understanding of iOS SDK-Strong skills in analyzing system logs and debugging-Good written, verbal communication skills and the ability to work in a team-Proven experience with writing, releasing, maintaining mobile applications-Design system tokens, version control processes, unit testing, and accessibility.-Communicating effectively with your product team on domain, design, coding, and architectural approaches-Author technical documentation to support delivery, maintenance, adoption-Design and develop automated deployment and maintenance mechanisms-Prepare for and provide regular demonstrations on approaches and deliverables.-Prepare demos, proof of concept systems, and prototypes-Experience working with DevOps and Agile development models-Strong analytical and troubleshooting skills-Experience with performance analysis and optimization-Strong UX skills in Interaction, Visual Design, and animation-Experience with code review and mentoring to help fellow engineers grow, improve, and adopt-Commitment to test-driven approachesU.S. Bank will consider qualified applicants with criminal histories in a manner consistent with the San Francisco Fair Chance Ordinance.Benefits:Take care of yourself and your family with U.S. Bank employee benefits. We know that healthy employees are happy employees, and we believe that work/life balance should be easy to achieve. That's why we share the cost of benefits and offer a variety of programs, resources and support you need to bring your full self to work and stay present and committed to the people who matter most - your family.Learn all about U.S. Bank employee benefits, including tuition reimbursement, retirement plans and more, by visitingusbank.com/careers.EEO is the LawApplicants can learn more about the company's status as an equal opportunity employer by viewing the federal EEO is the Law poster.E-VerifyU.S. Bank participates in the U.S. Department of Homeland Security E-Verify program in all facilities located in the United States and certain U.S. territories. The E-Verify program is an Internet-based employment eligibility verification system operated by the U.S. Citizenship and Immigration Services. Learn more about theE-Verify program.
